lines.text: Sheriff of Nottingham, in gratitude for your faithful service, I shall knight thee.
Your most gracious Majesty.
In the name of my most royal Majesty, I knight thee.

[Conks the Sheriff on the head with his scepter]
Arise, Sir Loin of Beef.

[Conks him again]
Arise, Earl of Cloves.

[Conk]
Arise, Duke of Brittingham.

[Conk]
Arise, Baron of Munchausen.

[Conk]
Arise, Essence of Myrrh...

[Conk]
Milk of Magnesia...

[Conk]
Quarter of ten.

[extremely dazed]
You are too kind, Your Majesty.

[Disguised Bugs turns his head aside and speaks to audience]
Got lots of stamina!
[1st "knighting of Sheriff of Nottingham", Sir Loin of Beef, was later used as the name of a knight King Arthur's Table, in Bugs Bunny's only award winning short Knighty Knight Bugs]
[last lines]
Don't you worry, never fear, Ro...

Yeah, I know, Robin Hood will soon be here. He robs from the rich and he gives to the poor. Yo-ho-ho, he goes skipping, tra-la-la, through Sherwood Forest, helping the needy and the oppressed. Ah, you've been saying that through the whole picture! Well, where is he?
Oh, you should not talk mean like that, because there he is!

[Appears in live-action footage three to five second cameo]
Welcome to Sherwood.

[Bugs stares in astonishment for a moment]
Nah, that's silly. It couldn't be him.
Don't you worry, never fear. Robin Hood will soon be here.
[Little John blew a fanfare on bugle and stood at attention]
Yeah, Mr. Wise Guy. Now you're gonna get it. Robin Hood'll fix you, brother.
[after a long pause, Little John looks to the distance, shrugs his shoulders in dis-belief and then leaves]
Eh, where was we?
It's the rack for you, me long-eared fellow. The King shall indeed be proud of me.
King? Lo, the King approacheth!
The King? Where? Where?
There, there, o'er yon flowered bank!

[the Sheriff of Nottingham bows his head]
Your Majesty.
[after Bugs hit the Sheriff of Nottingham's head with a club numerous times, little kings float around his head]
Ods fish! The very air abounds in kings.

[Bugs runs into the King's Royal Rose Gardens]
Stop! Stop! You can't go in there! You're not allowed in there! This is the King's private garden! You're standing on royal ground!
Royal ground? You mean to say that this ground is better than that ground over there?
Yes, it is!
Oh, I don't know. Now, you take this piece of ground over here. Now here's a nice piece of property. Level, fruit trees, choice view, improvements already in. Eh, what type of house was you planning?
Well, I... I sort of had a six-room Tudor in mind.
Then this is the just the place for you, and it's priced just right. But, uh, first, uh... Are you a veteran?
No, I'm a...
Good, then it'll be easy. Here, just sign on the dotted line.
Well, uh... couldn't I call you later? You see, I...
Well, I don't know. You see, there was a couple here from Kansas City looking at this place this morning, and they...
All right! I'll sign! I'll sign! Here!
You'll never regret it, my friend. This place will double in value inside six months.
[Cut to the Sheriff working on a half-finished house in the Garden when he suddenly realizes what he was deceived]
Ooh! I hate myself! I do! I do! I do!
[the Sheriff of Nottingham hits himself in the head with his hammer repeatedly, almost contemplating suicide]
[Opening lines]
[Bugs Bunny pulls a carrot, that has an alarm bell. He then tries to stop the bells' ringing and the Sheriff of Nottingam arrives to guard the King's garden]
It's the rack for you, me long-aired knave.
